main.docTitle: Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: ancillary vessel (附屬船隻), in relation to a local vessel, means a vessel that falls within the description of an ancillary vessel endorsed under section 13 on the certificate of ownership of the local vessel;

def.name: CertificateOfOwnership
def.leadIn: certificate of ownership (擁有權證明書) means a certificate of ownership—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issued under section 10; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issued or endorsed under section 23 or 26 (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29);

subsection.def: certificate of ownership number (擁有權證明書號碼) means a number assigned by the Director under section 11(2) to the certificate of ownership of a local vessel;
certificate of survey (驗船證明書) means a certificate of survey within the meaning of the Survey Regulation;

def.name: DocumentOfIdentification
def.leadIn: document of identification (身分證明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an individual, the identity card issued to the individual under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), the certificate of incorporation issued in respect of the company under the Ordinance under which the company was formed and registered; or (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), the certificate of registration issued in respect of the company under the Ordinance under which the company was registered as a registered non- Hong Kong company; (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.def: floating restaurant (水上食肆) means any vessel that customarily remains stationary in any area of the waters of Hong Kong that is used or is constructed for use primarily for the purpose of a food business involving the sale of meals to the general public for consumption on board;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a full licence that is issued under section 15 or renewed under section 17; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a full licence issued, endorsed or renewed under section 23 or 26 (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29);

subsection.def: Local Certificate of Competency Rules (《本地合格證明書規則》) means the rules made under section 16 of the Ordinance;

def.name: MaterialConsiderations
def.leadIn: material considerations (考慮因素), in relation to a local vessel, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the class and type for which the vessel is or is to be certificated and the intended service of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provisions of the Ordinance and regulations made under the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the condition of the vessel so far as it is relevant to seaworthiness or to any risk of pollution;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the safety, health and welfare of persons employed or engaged in any capacity on board the vessel; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other matter of public interest;

subsection.def: permission for a laid-up vessel (閑置船隻允許書) means the written permission granted under section 66 of the Ordinance for a laid-up vessel to be berthed, moored or anchored at any place in the waters of Hong Kong, including such permission that is endorsed or granted under section 23 or 26 (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29);
prescribed fee (訂明費用) means a fee prescribed by regulation made under section 88 of the Ordinance;
specified form (指明表格) means a form specified by the Director;
specified sheltered waters (指明遮蔽水域) means the waters specified in Schedule 2;
Survey Regulation (《驗船規例》) means any regulation made in relation to the survey or inspection of vessels under section 89 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a temporary licence issued or renewed under section 19; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a temporary licence issued, endorsed or renewed under section 23 or 26 (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29);

subsection.def: typhoon shelter (避風塘) means a typhoon shelter specified in the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Typhoon Shelters) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. E);

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means any day other than the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined in section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

subsection.content: A local vessel is certificated under this Regulation if there is in force in respect of it a certificate of ownership.

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a local vessel of any class and of any type is a reference to a local vessel certificated for that class and that type in accordance with section 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a Class I, II, III or IV vessel is a reference to a local vessel certificated for Class I, II, III or IV respectively.

subsection.content: A local vessel is licensed under this Regulation if there is in force in respect of it a full licence or a temporary licence.

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a person applying for certification as the owner, in relation to a local vessel, is a reference to a person who pursuant to an application made under section 10, 23 or 26 (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29) is to be named as the owner in the certificate of ownership to be issued or endorsed in respect of the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a certificated owner, in relation to a local vessel, is a reference to a person who is named as the owner in the certificate of ownership of the vessel that is in force.

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, a transfer of ownership of a local vessel includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transfer of an interest of a joint or part owner in a local vessel to any person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any disposition of interest in a local vessel by a personal representative of the estate of a deceased owner.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of this Regulation
section.content: This Regulation applies to local vessels to which Part IV of the Ordinance applies.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Certificate of Ownership, Full Licence, Temporary Licence and Permission for a Laid-up Vessel

section.name: s4
section.heading: Class and type of local vessels

subsection.content: A local vessel, where certificated under this Regulation, shall be so certificated for Class I, II, III or IV and for a type specified opposite the relevant class in Schedule 1.

Where a local vessel is certificated for a particular class and type, a full licence, a temporary licence, or permission for a laid-up vessel that is issued, renewed, granted or endorsed under section 15, 17, 19, 23 or 26 of this Regulation (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29) or section 66 of the Ordinance in respect of the vessel shall be so issued, renewed, granted or endorsed in respect of the vessel as a local vessel of that class and type.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Restrictions on vessels of Classes II and III

subsection.content: No full licence or temporary licence for a Class II vessel shall permit the vessel to carry more than 12 passengers.
No full licence or temporary licence for a Class III vessel shall permit the vessel to carry any passenger.
A Class III vessel shall be used exclusively for fishing and related purposes.

If a Class III vessel is used in contravention of subsection (3) without reasonable excuse, the owner, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Restrictions on Class IV vessels

subsection.leadIn: A Class IV vessel shall not be used otherwise than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the owner exclusively for pleasure purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it has been let to any person, by that person exclusively for pleasure purposes.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A Class IV vessel must not be let for hire or reward unless there is an endorsement on the vessel’s operating licence showing that approval for the vessel to be let for hire or reward has been given by the Director. (L.N. 68 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: If an owner of a Class IV vessel intends to let the vessel for hire or reward for an intended service that involves the carriage of passengers, the owner must, when applying for or renewing an operating licence in respect of the vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicate that it is the owner’s intention to let the vessel for hire or reward;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit to the Director copies of the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey referred to in subsection (3)(a) and the policy of insurance referred to in subsection (3)(b); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: seek the Director’s approval for the vessel to be let for hire or reward. (L.N. 68 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: If the Director approves a Class IV vessel to be let for hire or reward, the Director must make an endorsement to that effect on the vessel’s operating licence. (L.N. 68 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: If subsection (1A) is contravened in respect of a vessel, the owner of the vessel, the owner’s agent and the coxswain of the vessel each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (L.N. 68 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.content: During the transitional period, a contravention of subsection (1A) does not constitute an offence under subsection (1D). (L.N. 68 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1F
subsection.content: For subsection (1E), transitional period means the 12-month period beginning on 1 August 2020. (L.N. 68 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: A Class IV vessel shall not be let for hire or reward unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is let under the terms of a written charter agreement or written hire-purchase agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the agreement contains a warning that states clearly—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the person to whom the vessel is let commits an offence if he does not comply with section 6(5)(b) of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the person to whom the vessel is let should read carefully section 6 (except subsections (1), (2) and (4)) of the Regulation; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where in the agreement the full text of those provisions may be found;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the agreement contains, either in its body or as its attachment, the full text of this section (except subsections (1), (2) and (4));

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the warning and text referred to in paragraphs (b) and (c) are in the same language as that of the remaining parts of the agreement and are presented prominently in the agreement; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the agreement is signed by the owner and the person to whom the vessel is let.

subsection.leadIn: A Class IV vessel shall not be let for hire or reward for an intended service that involves the carriage of passengers unless there is in force in respect of the vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such certificate of inspection or certificate of survey certifying that the vessel is fit for the intended service as is required under the Survey Regulation for a Class IV vessel of the type for which the vessel is certificated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such policy of insurance in respect of third party risks as is required under Part VA of the Ordinance for a Class IV vessel of the type for which the vessel is certificated, having regard to the intended service. (24 of 2005 s. 23)

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1), (2) or (3) is contravened the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: Where a Class IV vessel is let for hire or reward—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the owner, his agent and the coxswain shall ensure that there is kept on board the vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the relevant written charter agreement or written hire-purchase agreement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if any passenger is carried in the vessel, the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey and the policy of insurance referred to in subsection (3), or certified copies of them; (24 of 2005 s. 23)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person to whom the vessel is let shall ensure that throughout the period when the person is in possession of the vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the vessel is not used otherwise than by him exclusively for pleasure purposes; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the documents referred to in paragraph (a) are kept on board the vessel; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the coxswain shall, on request by an authorized officer, produce for inspection the documents referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (5), commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

A person to whom a Class IV vessel is let does not have a reasonable excuse for contravening subsection (5)(b)(ii) merely because the person’s contravention is attributable to the contravention by the owner, his agent and the coxswain of subsection (5)(a).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of this section, a Class IV vessel is to be regarded as being used by a person exclusively for pleasure purposes if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the person being an individual, the vessel is used to carry the individual, his family members, relatives, friends and employees, and family members, relatives and friends of his employees, for their pleasure purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the person being a club, company, partnership or association of persons, the vessel is used to carry its members and employees, and family members, relatives and friends of those members and employees, for their pleasure purposes.

subsection.content: If a person to whom a Class IV vessel is let under a hire-purchase agreement is named in the certificate of ownership as owner by virtue of section 9(b), then subsections (3) and (5) apply neither to the hire-purchase agreement nor to the vessel as far as that agreement is concerned.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Agent

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the certificated owner of a local vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a person applying for certification as the owner in relation to a local vessel,

subsection.continued: may appoint another person as his agent for the purposes of this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: A person may be appointed as an agent only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a person referred to in section 12(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has a shore address in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person (principal) shall, before having another person act for him as his agent for the purposes of this Regulation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notice of appointment signed by the principal and the agent which shall, if the agent is an individual, contain a declaration made by the agent that the agent is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the document of identification of the agent or a certified copy of it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the principal is the certificated owner of the vessel, produce to the Director the certificate of ownership and pay the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The notice of appointment shall contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the principal is the certificated owner of the vessel, the certificate of ownership number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the principal is a person applying for certification as the owner, the particulars of the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of the vessel, if any, specified under section 40(5);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name of the principal;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the name, shore address in Hong Kong and telephone number of the agent;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a statement by the principal that he appoints the agent for the purposes of this Regulation; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the agent’s consent to act as agent for the principal and to perform all functions (including the assumption of all obligations) as such agent under this Regulation.

subsection.content: The Director shall endorse the particulars of the agent on the certificate of ownership that is produced under subsection (3)(b).

In the case of the principal being a person applying for certification as the owner, the Director shall endorse the particulars of the agent on the certificate of ownership when it is issued or endorsed under section 10, 23 or 26 (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29).
The particulars of an agent to be endorsed on a certificate of ownership are the name and address of the agent, and the number appearing on the document of identification of the agent.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Resignation, etc. of agent

subsection.content: An agent who resigns shall forthwith give a written notice of the resignation, signed by him, to the person who appointed him and shall send a copy of the notice to the Director.
An agent shall, if he ceases to meet the requirements in section 7(2), forthwith resign in the manner stated in subsection (1).

If the Director is satisfied that an agent appointed in relation to a local vessel ceases to meet the requirements in section 7(2), the Director may, by written notice to the agent and the person who appointed the agent, inform them that the appointment of the agent ceases to be accepted as valid.
A person who revokes the appointment of his agent shall forthwith give written notice of the revocation, signed by him, to the agent and shall send a copy of the notice to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: If the certificate of ownership of a local vessel is in the possession of an agent appointed in respect of the vessel when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he gives a notice of resignation under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he receives a notice of cessation of validity of appointment under subsection (3) or a notice of revocation under subsection (4),

subsection.continued: he shall, at the time he gives the relevant notice or within 7 working days after he receives the relevant notice (as the case may be), return the certificate of ownership to the person who appointed him.

subsection.leadIn: The certificated owner of the vessel shall deliver the certificate of ownership on which particulars of an agent appointed by him are endorsed to the Director, and pay the prescribed fee, for Director’s endorsement of the termination of appointment of the agent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within 7 working days after he receives a notice of resignation under subsection (1) or a notice of cessation of validity of appointment under subsection (3) (as the case may be); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the time he gives a notice of revocation under subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (6) applies, within 7 working days after he receives the certificate of ownership from the agent.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2), (4), (6) or (7) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

part.crossHeading: Certificate of ownership: application, issue and endorsements

section.name: s9
section.heading: Eligibility for certification as the owner
section.leadIn: A person is eligible to be named as the owner of a local vessel in the certificate of ownership in respect of the vessel if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: owns the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is the person to whom the vessel is let under a hire-purchase agreement in respect of the vessel and is entitled to possession of the vessel.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Application for certificate of ownership

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, on application, issue a certificate of ownership in respect of a local vessel in the name of a person as the owner for a class and a type if the Director is satisfied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is eligible to be named as the owner of the vessel under section 9; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is a person referred to in section 12(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the vessel is constructed for operation as a local vessel of that class and that type.

subsection.content: An application for the purpose of subsection (1) may be made by a person who meets the requirements in subsection (1)(a) or the person’s agent.

subsection.leadIn: An application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be made to the Director in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be made at the time when an application for a full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel is made.

subsection.leadIn: An application shall indicate the class and the type that the vessel is to be certificated for and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name, shore address in Hong Kong and telephone number of the person who is to be named as the owner;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a general description and the technical particulars of the vessel;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a declaration made by the applicant that the general description and the technical particulars of the vessel contained in the application are correct;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the person who is to be named as the owner is an individual, a declaration made by the person that he is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the year and place of construction of the vessel; (L.N. 63 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the year of purchase and the purchase price;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: a description of the material of which the hull of the vessel is constructed; and

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: a declaration made by the applicant as to whether the vessel is a used vessel and, if so, where the vessel was used;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: proof for the claim that the person who is to be named as the owner is eligible to be so named under section 9; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the document of identification of the person who is to be named as the owner, or a certified copy of it; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the vessel is a used vessel from a place outside Hong Kong, shall be accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the vessel’s previous certificate of ownership, certificate of registry, licence or document of a similar nature;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a confirmation in writing by a relevant authority in that place that the certificate, licence or document has been cancelled; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other evidence of its previous use in that place.

subsection.content: The Director may require an applicant to provide such other information and documents as may be reasonably required for determining an application.
The Director, in refusing to issue a certificate of ownership, shall notify the applicant of the refusal and the reasons therefor.

Even if an application under this section indicates that a local vessel is to be certificated for a particular class and a particular type, the Director may, with the agreement of the applicant, treat the application as an application for the vessel to be certificated for another class and another type and issue a certificate of ownership accordingly.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Certificate of ownership

subsection.content: A certificate of ownership shall be in such form as the Director may determine.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of ownership shall be assigned with a number by the Director and shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the class and the type that the local vessel is certificated for;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the vessel, if any, specified under section 40(5);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and shore address in Hong Kong of the person whom the Director is satisfied to be eligible to be named as the owner under section 9 and the number appearing on the document of identification of the owner;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the business name of the owner (if any) included under section 12;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an endorsement of the particulars of an agent (if any) under section 7;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the year and place of construction of the vessel;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the year of purchase and the purchase price;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the length and breadth (in metres) of the vessel;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: (if the measurements are made) the depth (in metres) and the tonnage of the vessel;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a description of the material of which the hull of the vessel is constructed;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: an endorsement as to ancillary vessel (if any) under section 13; and

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: an endorsement as to mortgage or hire-purchase agreement (if any) under section 14.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Inclusion of business name of owner in certificate of ownership

subsection.content: The Director may, on request, include the business name of the certificated owner of a local vessel in the certificate of ownership.

subsection.leadIn: A request for the purpose of subsection (1) in relation to a local vessel may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the certificated owner or his agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall make a request for the purpose of subsection (1) in writing and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if he is the certificated owner or his agent, shall produce the certificate of ownership and pay the prescribed fee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he is a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent, shall state the particulars of the application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall produce the business registration certificate issued under the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310) or a copy of the certificate certified under section 19(1)(a) of that Ordinance or certified by the person making the request. (13 of 2010 s. 29)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Ancillary vessel to be covered by certificate of ownership and full licence, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, on request, make on the certificate of ownership for a local vessel an endorsement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the certificated vessel being a Class III vessel, to the effect that the certificated vessel may be used with one or more ancillary vessels where each ancillary vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: belongs to the same owner as the certificated vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not exceed 4 metres in length overall; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is not fitted with an engine; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the certificated vessel being a Class IV vessel, to the effect that the certificated vessel may be used with one ancillary vessel being a vessel that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: belongs to the same owner as the certificated vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not exceed 4 metres in length overall; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: either is not fitted with an engine or is fitted with engines not exceeding 7.5 kilowatts total propulsion power.

subsection.leadIn: A request for the purpose of subsection (1) in respect of a local vessel may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the certificated owner or his agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall make a request for the purpose of subsection (1) in writing and shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if he is the certificated owner or his agent, produce the certificate of ownership and pay the prescribed fee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he is a person applying for certification or the person’s agent, state the particulars of the application.

subsection.leadIn: Where the certificate of ownership of a local vessel is endorsed under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a vessel that falls within the description for the ancillary vessel as endorsed, and is carried on the certificated vessel when not in use or used in conjunction with the certificated vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: shall be regarded as part of the certificated vessel; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: shall not require a separate certificate of ownership or a separate full licence, temporary licence, or permission for a laid-up vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conditions or restrictions attached to a full licence, temporary licence, or permission for a laid-up vessel in respect of the certificated vessel shall apply to each ancillary vessel unless otherwise specified by the Director in the conditions or restrictions.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Endorsement as to mortgage or hire-purchase agreement

subsection.content: The Director may make, on the certificate of ownership for a local vessel, an endorsement to the effect that a mortgage or hire-purchase agreement subsists in relation to the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: A request for the purpose of subsection (1) in respect of a local vessel may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the certificated owner or his agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall make a request for the purpose of subsection (1) in writing and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall produce the relevant proof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he is the certificated owner or his agent, shall produce the certificate of ownership and pay the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if he is a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent, shall state the particulars of the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, on request, amend an endorsement made under this section. A request for amending an endorsement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be made in accordance with subsections (2) and (3) with necessary modifications; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be accompanied by the written consent to the amendment, signed by each party, other than the person by or for whom the request is made, to the mortgage or hire-purchase agreement (as the case may be).

part.crossHeading: Full licence: application, issue and renewal

section.name: s15
section.heading: Application for full licence

subsection.content: The Director may, on application, issue in respect of a local vessel a full licence, if the applicant satisfies the Director that it is appropriate to issue it having regard to the material considerations.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purpose of subsection (1) in respect of a local vessel may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the certificated owner or his agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent.

subsection.content: An application shall be made in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: An application shall be accompanied by the following documents in respect of the vessel, or their certified copies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such certificate of survey as is required under the Survey Regulation for the vessel, having regard to the class and type for which the vessel is or is to be certificated and its intended service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such policy of insurance in respect of third party risks as is required under Part VA of the Ordinance for the vessel, having regard to the class and type for which the vessel is or is to be certificated and its intended service. (24 of 2005 s. 25)

subsection.content: The Director may require an applicant to provide such other information and documents as may be reasonably required for determining the application.
The Director, in refusing an application for the issue of a full licence, shall notify the applicant of the refusal and the reasons therefor.
A full licence shall be in such form as the Director may determine.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Validity period for full licence
section.content: A full licence for a local vessel is valid for such period as may be determined by the Director and specified in the licence, which shall not exceed 12 months, beginning from the date of issue of the licence.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Renewal of full licence

subsection.content: The owner of a local vessel or his agent may apply for renewal of a full licence in respect of the vessel not earlier than 2 months prior to the expiry of the licence.
Sections 15 and 16, with necessary modifications, apply to an application under subsection (1) for renewal of a full licence as they apply to an application under section 15 for its issue.
A renewal of the full licence in respect of a local vessel before the expiry of the licence shall take effect on the day following the day of the expiry.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Conditions and restrictions attached to full licence

subsection.leadIn: Having regard to the material considerations, the Director may attach to a full licence in respect of a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any conditions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any restrictions that the vessel concerned may only ply within certain specified sheltered waters, typhoon shelters or other areas. (24 of 2005 s. 26)

subsection.content: The Director may, having regard to the material considerations, amend any conditions or restrictions attached to a full licence in respect of a local vessel and may request the owner or his agent to deliver the licence to him for the purpose of making the amendments.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to deliver a full licence on request under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

part.crossHeading: Temporary licence: application, issue and renewal

section.name: s19
section.heading: Issue or renewal of temporary licence

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel is not eligible for issue or renewal of a full licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a full licence for a local vessel is deemed to be suspended under section 32 pending the issue of a certificate of survey,

subsection.continued: the Director may, on application, issue a temporary licence for the vessel if the applicant satisfies the Director that it is appropriate to issue it having regard to the material considerations.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purpose of subsection (1) in respect of a local vessel may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the certificated owner or his agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent.

subsection.content: An application shall be made in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.
A temporary licence shall be in such form as the Director may determine.

A temporary licence shall be issued for such period as may be determined by the Director and specified in the licence, which shall not exceed 12 months, beginning from the date of issue of the licence.

A temporary licence for a local vessel may be renewed on an application made not earlier than 2 months prior to the expiry of the licence, and subsections (1) to (5), with necessary modifications, apply to an application for renewal of a temporary licence as they apply to an application for its issue.
A renewal of the temporary licence in respect of a local vessel before the expiry of the licence shall take effect on the day following the day of the expiry.
If the Director refuses to issue or renew a temporary licence, he shall notify the applicant of the refusal and the reasons therefor. (L.N. 63 of 2004)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Conditions and restrictions attached to temporary licence

subsection.leadIn: Having regard to the material considerations, the Director may attach to a temporary licence in respect of a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any conditions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any restrictions that the vessel concerned may only ply within certain specified sheltered waters, typhoon shelters or other areas. (24 of 2005 s. 27)

subsection.content: The Director may, having regard to the material considerations, amend any conditions or restrictions attached to a temporary licence in respect of a local vessel and may request the owner or his agent to deliver the licence to him for the purpose of making the amendments.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to deliver a temporary licence on request under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Grant of permission for a laid-up vessel

subsection.leadIn: An application for the grant of permission for a laid-up vessel in respect of a local vessel may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the certificated owner or his agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent.

subsection.content: An application shall be made to the Director in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

Without prejudice to the provisions of section 66 of the Ordinance, the Director may refuse to grant permission for a laid-up vessel in respect of a local vessel if no appropriate place is available for the vessel to be berthed, moored or anchored.
A permission for a laid-up vessel shall be in such form as the Director may determine. (L.N. 63 of 2004)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Notice of transfer of local vessel

subsection.leadIn: Within 7 working days after the transfer of the ownership of a certificated local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the original owner or his agent shall deliver to the Director—

subparagraph.content: the original owner’s copy of the notice of transfer of ownership;
the certificate of ownership relating to the vessel; and
any full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel relating to the vessel; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the new owner of the vessel or his agent shall deliver to the Director the new owner’s copy of the notice of transfer of ownership.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of transfer of ownership referred to in subsection (1) shall contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name, shore address in Hong Kong and telephone number of the new owner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate of ownership number of the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date of the transfer of ownership; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where an endorsement as to a mortgage of or as to a hire-purchase agreement for the vessel is made on the certificate of ownership, the written consent to the transfer, signed by each party, other than the original owner, to the mortgage or hire-purchase agreement (as the case may be).

subsection.content: A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of the certificate and the licence or permission delivered under subsection (1)(b), the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall cancel the certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall cancel the licence or revoke the permission unless the licence or permission is endorsed under section 23(1)(b)(i).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Certificate of ownership, full licence, etc. in favour of new owner after transfer of local vessel

subsection.leadIn: Where the ownership of a certificated local vessel is transferred, the Director may on an application under subsection (2) and if satisfied that the person named in the application as the new owner of the vessel is eligible to be named as the owner of the vessel in a certificate of ownership under section 9(a) and is a person referred to in section 12(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of ownership in respect of the vessel in which the person is named as the owner; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: make an endorsement on any full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable) in respect of the vessel to reflect the transfer of ownership; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: issue a full licence or temporary licence or grant permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable) in respect of the vessel in which the person is named as the owner.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purpose of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be made by the new owner of the vessel to whom it is transferred or his agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be made in writing within 7 working days after the transfer and either at the time a notice of transfer under section 22 is delivered or after its delivery;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name, shore address in Hong Kong and telephone number of the new owner;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the certificate of ownership number of the vessel; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the new owner of the vessel is an individual, a declaration made by the new owner that he is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the document of identification of the new owner, or a certified copy of it;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an application for endorsement or issue of a full licence or temporary licence under subsection (1), such policy of insurance in respect of third party risks as is required for the vessel under Part VA of the Ordinance, or a certified copy of that policy of insurance; and (24 of 2005 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may require an applicant to provide such other information and documents as may be reasonably required for determining the application.

The Director may grant an application under subsection (2) on being satisfied of the matters referred to in subsection (1), even if the original owner of the vessel and his agent fail to comply with section 22(1)(b).
If the Director refuses an application under subsection (2), he shall notify the applicant of the refusal and the reasons therefor. (L.N. 63 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: Where the ownership of a local vessel has been transferred, no person shall operate the vessel, and the new owner of the vessel, his agent, the coxswain shall not permit the vessel to operate, after the expiration of 7 working days after the transfer, unless, in accordance with this section— (L.N. 63 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of ownership is issued in respect of the vessel in which the new owner is named as the owner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a full licence or temporary licence is endorsed to reflect the transfer in favour of the new owner, or a full licence or temporary licence is issued to the new owner.

subsection.content: Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (6) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (L.N. 63 of 2004)

part.crossHeading: Cessation of certificate of ownership on death or dissolution of owner, etc.; interim ownership

section.name: s24
section.heading: Certificate of ownership and other documents ceasing to have effect on death or dissolution of owner, etc.
section.leadIn: The certificate of ownership of a local vessel, and a full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel for the vessel, shall cease to have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless otherwise provided for in section 23 or 26 (including, in the case of section 23, that section as applied by section 29), on the death of the individual named as the owner of the vessel in the certificate of ownership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the dissolution of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) that is named as the owner of the vessel in the certificate of ownership; (30 of 2004 s. 3; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on the person named as the owner of the vessel in the certificate of ownership ceasing to be a person referred to in section 12(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on the vessel being despatched permanently from Hong Kong or being broken up or destroyed.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Notice of death or dissolution of owner, etc.

subsection.content: Where an individual who is named in the certificate of ownership as the owner of a local vessel has died (deceased owner), a person who is entitled to the vessel on his death (whether under a will of the deceased owner, on his intestacy, or otherwise) shall, within 30 days after the death, notify the Director in writing of the fact.

Where a company or registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) named in the certificate of ownership as the owner of a local vessel has been dissolved, every person who, immediately before the dissolution, was a director of or an officer concerned in the management of the company shall, within 7 working days after the dissolution, notify the Director in writing of the fact. (30 of 2004 s. 3; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

Where a person who is named as the owner in the certificate of ownership in respect of a local vessel ceases to be a person referred to in section 12(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance, the person shall, either by himself or through his agent and within 7 working days after the cessation, notify the Director in writing of the fact.

Where a local vessel has been despatched permanently from Hong Kong or has been broken up or destroyed after a certificate of ownership was issued, the owner of the vessel shall, either by himself or through his agent and within 7 working days after the despatch, breaking up or destruction, notify the Director in writing of the fact.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is required to give a notice under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) in respect of a local vessel shall at the time of giving the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver to the Director the certificate of ownership together with the full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable) in respect of the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where an endorsement as to a mortgage of or as to a hire-purchase agreement for the vessel is made on the certificate of ownership, send a copy of the notice to each party, other than the person by or for whom the notice is given, to the mortgage or hire-purchase agreement (as the case may be).

subsection.content: A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

On receipt of the certificate and the licence or permission delivered under this section, the Director shall cancel the certificate and shall cancel the licence or revoke the permission, unless the certificate and the licence or permission are endorsed under section 23 (as applied by section 29) or under section 26.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Person entitled to local vessel on owner’s death may be interim owner

subsection.leadIn: After the death of the individual named as the owner of a local vessel in the certificate of ownership (deceased owner), if an application is made under subsection (2) and the applicant satisfies the Director that the applicant is a person mentioned in subsection (2), the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may make an endorsement on any certificate of ownership and on a full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable) issued to the deceased owner in respect of the vessel to the effect that the applicant is the interim owner of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may issue a certificate of ownership, and may issue a full licence or temporary licence or grant permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable), in which the applicant is named as the interim owner of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purpose of subsection (1) may be made by a person referred to in section 12(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is entitled to the vessel on the death of the deceased owner (whether under a will of the deceased owner, on his intestacy, or otherwise); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whom all the persons having an interest in the estate of the deceased owner appoint in writing to operate the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: An application shall be made in writing and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name, shore address in Hong Kong and telephone number of the applicant;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the certificate of ownership number of the vessel;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the applicant is an individual, a declaration made by the applicant that he is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: where an endorsement as to a mortgage of or as to a hire-purchase agreement for the vessel is made on the certificate of ownership, the written consent to the applicant being named as interim owner of the vessel, signed by each party, other than the deceased owner, to the mortgage or hire-purchase agreement (as the case may be); and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the document of identification of the applicant, or a certified copy of it, and proof for the claim that the applicant is a person referred to in subsection (2);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an application for endorsement or issue of a full licence or temporary licence under subsection (1), such policy of insurance in respect of third party risks as is required for the vessel under Part VA of the Ordinance, or a certified copy of that policy of insurance; and (24 of 2005 s. 29)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Director may require an applicant to provide such other information and documents as may be reasonably required for determining the application.
If the Director refuses an application under subsection (2), he shall notify the applicant of the refusal and the reasons therefor. (L.N. 63 of 2004)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Implications of interim ownership

subsection.leadIn: If a certificate of ownership endorsed or issued under section 26 in respect of a local vessel, in which a person is named as the interim owner, is in force, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless otherwise provided for under this section or in the certificate of ownership, the Ordinance and regulations made under it shall apply to the person named as the interim owner as if he were the owner of the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the liability of any person for or in respect of the vessel otherwise than under this paragraph, a person named as the interim owner is liable under the Ordinance and regulations made under it for and in respect of the vessel as if he were the owner of the vessel.

subsection.content: Except as provided for in subsection (1), section 26 shall not affect any issue relating to the ownership of a local vessel or the interest that any person may have in the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of transfer in respect of a local vessel signed by the interim owner of the vessel as the original owner shall not be accepted by the Director for the purpose of section 22; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that a person is named as interim owner of a local vessel under section 26 does not by itself give such interim owner a right to operate the vessel and does not affect any claim a person having an interest in the vessel may have against such interim owner arising from the operation of the vessel by such interim owner.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Cancellation of interim ownership

subsection.content: The Director shall cancel any certificate of ownership, and shall cancel a full licence or temporary licence or revoke any permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable), in which a person is named as interim owner of a local vessel if the Director ceases to be satisfied that the person is a person referred to in section 26(2). The Director shall exercise the power of cancellation or revocation by notice in writing given to the interim owner concerned.

The interim owner named in any certificate of ownership and a full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel shall deliver them to the Director, within 7 working days after their cancellation or revocation under subsection (1).
A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Certificate of ownership, full licence, etc. in favour of person to whom personal representative has transferred the local vessel

subsection.leadIn: If, after the grant of representation of the estate of the deceased owner of a local vessel, the personal representative of the estate transfers the ownership of the vessel to any person, then subject to this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 22 and 23 apply to the transfer as if references in those sections to the original owner and new owner of the vessel were references to the personal representative of the estate and the person to whom the vessel is transferred respectively; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of ownership and a full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel, in which the person to whom the vessel is transferred is named as the owner, may be issued, endorsed, or granted in respect of the vessel accordingly.

subsection.content: The personal representative of the estate of the deceased owner shall be taken to have contravened section 22 (as applied by subsection (1) of this section) unless he delivers to the Director a certified copy of the probate or letters of administration in respect of the estate at the time he delivers his copy of the notice of transfer of ownership in respect of the vessel in compliance with section 22 (so applied).

subsection.leadIn: The requirements in section 22(1)(b)(ii) and (iii) (as applied by subsection (1) of this section) for delivery of the certificate of ownership and the full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the personal representative or the person to whom the vessel is transferred is named as the interim owner of the vessel under section 26, be read as a requirement for the personal representative or the person (as the case may be) to deliver to the Director the certificate of ownership and the full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel issued, endorsed, or granted in respect of the vessel under section 26 at the time he delivers his copy of the notice of transfer of ownership in respect of the vessel in compliance with section 22 (as applied by subsection (1) of this section); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if paragraph (a) does not apply, be treated as if they were omitted.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of the certificate and the licence or permission delivered under subsection (3), the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall cancel the certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall cancel the licence or revoke the permission unless it is endorsed under section 23(1)(b)(i) (as applied by subsection (1) of this section).

section.name: s30
section.heading: Director may require return of certificate of ownership, etc. that cease to have effect because of section 24

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 25, if the Director is satisfied that the certificate of ownership, and the full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel, in respect of a local vessel have ceased to have effect because of section 24, he may by written notice given to the owner and, if it appears to the Director that those documents are in the possession of any other person, to that person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the owner and that person that the Director is so satisfied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the owner or that person (as the case may be) to deliver to the Director, within 7 working days after the notice is given, the documents.

subsection.content: Where an endorsement as to a mortgage of or as to a hire-purchase agreement for the vessel is made on the certificate of ownership, the Director shall send a copy of the notice referred to in subsection (1) to each party, other than the owner, to the mortgage or hire-purchase agreement (as the case may be).
Any person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a notice given under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Cancellation of certificate of ownership, etc. at owner’s request

subsection.content: At the request of the owner of a local vessel, the Director may cancel the certificate of ownership and may cancel the full licence, temporary licence or revoke the permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable) of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of subsection (1), the owner’s request shall be in writing and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall state the reason for the request for cancellation and revocation (if applicable) and how the owner proposes to dispose of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where an endorsement as to a mortgage of or as to a hire-purchase agreement for the vessel is made on the certificate of ownership, shall contain the written consent to the cancellation and revocation (if applicable) signed by each party, other than the owner, to the mortgage or hire-purchase agreement (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be accompanied by the certificate of ownership, and the full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel (as applicable), of the vessel.

part.crossHeading: Cancellation or suspension of full licence or temporary licence

section.name: s32
section.heading: Suspension of full licence, temporary licence after cancellation or suspension of certificate of survey
section.content: If the certificate of survey in respect of a local vessel is cancelled or suspended for any reason, the full licence or temporary licence for the vessel shall be deemed to be suspended until a certificate of survey is in force in respect of the vessel.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Suspension of full licence or temporary licence after damage of vessel

subsection.content: Where a local vessel sustains damage that may affect its seaworthiness or affect the safety of persons on board, the owner, his agent and the coxswain shall report the occurrence forthwith to the Director.

Having regard to the nature and extent of the damage reported under subsection (1), the Director may give a direction either orally or in writing to the owner, his agent or the coxswain that the vessel shall not operate until a Government surveyor or ship inspector has inspected the vessel and has found that the vessel is seaworthy and the safety of persons on board the vessel will not be at risk.

subsection.leadIn: If a Government surveyor or ship inspector, finds on inspection that the vessel is unseaworthy or unsafe, he shall notify the Director of the findings and the Director may by written notice given to the owner, his agent or the coxswain specifying the findings, suspend—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the certificate of survey (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the full licence or temporary licence,

subsection.continued: and the owner, his agent or the coxswain to whom the notice is given shall forthwith deliver the certificate and licence that are suspended to the Director.

subsection.content: The owner, his agent or the coxswain may, after proper repairs to the vessel, apply for the vessel to be re-inspected by a Government surveyor or ship inspector. (24 of 2005 s. 30)

If a Government surveyor or ship inspector finds on re-inspection that the vessel is seaworthy and the safety of persons on board the vessel will not be at risk, he shall notify the Director of the findings and the Director shall, on payment of the prescribed fee, terminate the suspension of the certificate of survey and the full licence or temporary licence under subsection (3) and return the certificate and the licence to the owner, his agent or the coxswain by whom they were delivered. (24 of 2005 s. 30)

A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) or fails to comply with a direction under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.def: In this section, ship inspector (驗船督察) means a person holding the office of Chief Ship Inspector, Senior Ship Inspector, Ship Inspector or Assistant Ship Inspector in the Government.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Cancellation or suspension of full licence or temporary licence for contravention of conditions or restrictions, etc.

subsection.leadIn: If, in respect of a local vessel, the Director believes on reasonable grounds that any conditions or restrictions attached to the full licence or temporary licence is contravened or the Ordinance or any regulation made under it is contravened, the Director may, without prejudice to the liability of any person for the contravention, by written notice given to the owner or his agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel or suspend the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the owner or his agent to deliver the licence to him within 7 working days after the notice is given.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to deliver a full licence or temporary licence that is cancelled or suspended as requested in a notice given under subsection (1), commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Cancellation of full licence, temporary licence

subsection.content: Without prejudice to sections 31, 32, 33 and 34, the Director may cancel the full licence or temporary licence of a local vessel if the Director considers that it is inappropriate for the licence to continue to be in force having regard to the material considerations.

If the Director intends to cancel the full licence or temporary licence of a local vessel under subsection (1), he shall give written notice of his intention and the reasons therefor to the owner, and shall not cancel the licence until the expiry of 7 working days after the notice is given.

If the Director has given to the owner of a local vessel a notice under subsection (2) and, before the expiry of the 7 working days referred to in that subsection, the owner shows cause to the Director and satisfies him that the licence concerned should not be cancelled, the Director shall not cancel the licence for the reason set out in the notice given.

If the full licence or temporary licence of a local vessel is cancelled under subsection (1), the Director shall, by notice in writing given to the owner, inform the owner of the cancellation and request the owner to deliver the licence to him within 7 working days after the notice is given.

If without reasonable excuse a full licence or temporary licence that is cancelled is not delivered as requested in a notice given under subsection (4), the owner of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Requirements and Restrictions relating to Local Vessels

section.name: s36
section.heading: Contravention of conditions and restrictions
section.content: If, without reasonable excuse, any of the conditions or restrictions attached to a full licence or temporary licence in respect of a local vessel is contravened, the owner, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Notification of change of particulars in certificate of ownership

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a local vessel and his agent (if any) shall within 7 working days after any change in the particulars specified in the certificate of ownership under section 11—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the Director in writing of the change;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the Director with all such information as may be necessary for enabling him to verify the change so notified;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the certificate of ownership; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: pay the prescribed fee in respect of the notice of change.

subsection.continued: The Director shall amend the certificate of ownership and (if necessary) a full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel, or issue or grant new ones for replacement, to reflect the change so notified.

subsection.content: Where subsection (1) is contravened without reasonable excuse, the owner of the local vessel and his agent each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

This section does not apply to a change in respect of which notice is required to be given to the Director under section 7, 8, 22 or 25 (including, in the case of section 22, that section as applied by section 29).

section.name: s38
section.heading: Certificate of ownership number to be marked

subsection.leadIn: Each certificated local vessel and each of its ancillary vessels shall at all times have painted on it, or permanently affixed to or mounted on it, on each side of its deck housing where it can best be seen or on each side of the hull of the vessel where it can best be seen, the following marking—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a certificated local vessel, the certificate of ownership number of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an ancillary vessel of a certificated local vessel, the certificate of ownership number of the certificated vessel with a suffix “D” but, if there are more than one ancillary vessels, the suffixes for the ancillary vessels shall be “D”, “D2”, “D3” and so on.

subsection.leadIn: The certificate of ownership number shall be in figures; each figure, each letter that forms part of that number, and the suffix (if any) shall be in a colour that contrasts with the colour of the surface on which they appear and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a vessel not exceeding 10 metres in length overall, each figure, each letter, and the suffix shall be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least 70 millimetres in height;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in the case of the figure “1”, at least 40 millimetres in width; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: marked in lines that are at least 10 millimetres broad at every point;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a vessel exceeding 10 metres but not exceeding 24 metres in length overall, each figure, each letter, and the suffix shall be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least 150 millimetres in height;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in the case of the figure “1”, at least 90 millimetres in width; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: marked in lines that are at least 20 millimetres broad at every point; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a vessel exceeding 24 metres in length overall, each figure, each letter, and the suffix shall be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least 300 millimetres in height;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in the case of the figure “1”, at least 170 millimetres in width; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: marked in lines that are at least 40 millimetres broad at every point.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: tamper with, obscure or erase wholly or in part any marking on a local vessel or ancillary vessel required under subsections (1) and (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with subsections (1) and (2), display on a local vessel or ancillary vessel a number that does not comply with those subsections.

subsection.content: If any person contravenes subsection (4), that person, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

It is a defence for the owner of a local vessel, his agent, or the coxswain to a charge with an offence under subsection (5) to show that he could not with reasonable diligence have prevented the contravention of subsection (4).

section.name: s39
section.heading: Further identification of vessels

subsection.content: Having regard to the class and type of a local vessel and its intended service, the Director may, by written notice served on the owner, his agent or the coxswain, require that a local vessel be painted for the purpose of identification in such manner and colours, and within such period, as he may specify in the notice, but such a notice shall not be served in respect of a local vessel within 1 year after the vessel is painted in accordance with a notice previously served in respect of it under this section.

If, without reasonable excuse, a requirement imposed by a notice served under subsection (1) is not complied with, each person on whom the notice is served commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Display of vessel’s name and other mark

subsection.content: A local vessel shall not have displayed on it any name or mark, other than the certificate of ownership number, and the suffix (if applicable), painted, affixed or mounted on the vessel as required by section 38 unless the name or mark is kept separate and distinct from the number, and suffix (if applicable), so required.

A local vessel shall not have displayed on it any name or mark that gives a false impression that the vessel belongs to, is operated by or on behalf of, or is otherwise connected with, the Government.
If the name of a local vessel is specified under subsection (5) in the certificate of ownership, the vessel shall not have displayed on it another name as its name.

If a local vessel has a name or mark displayed in contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3), the owner, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

The Director may, on an application in accordance with subsection (6), specify in the certificate of ownership of a local vessel the name of the vessel, not being a name prohibited from being displayed under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purpose of subsection (5) in respect of a local vessel may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the certificated owner or his agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall make an application for the purpose of subsection (5) in writing and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if he is the certificated owner or his agent, produce the certificate of ownership and pay the prescribed fee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he is a person applying for certification as the owner or the person’s agent, shall state the particulars of the application for certification as the owner.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Prohibition against exclusive occupation of Hong Kong waters

subsection.content: No local vessel shall occupy an area of the waters of Hong Kong for its use exclusively.

Without prejudice to subsection (1), no local vessel shall remain stationary in an area of the waters of Hong Kong unless its full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel permits it to do so.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel to be kept in vessel

subsection.content: The full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel of a local vessel shall be kept on board the vessel and shall on request by an authorized officer be produced for inspection.

If a full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel in respect of a local vessel is withdrawn or is deposited with the Director for any reason other than cancellation or suspension, the Director may issue a certificate as proof of the fact of withdrawal or deposit. Such certificate shall be kept on board the vessel to which it relates, and shall on request by an authorized officer be produced for inspection, in lieu of the licence or permission.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Director may require delivery of local vessel for inspection

subsection.content: The Director may direct the owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain to deliver the vessel, within such time and at such place as the Director may direct, to the Director for inspection if he thinks it is reasonable to do so having regard to the material considerations.
A direction under subsection (1) may be given orally, in writing or in any other manner as the Director thinks fit.
An owner, agent or coxswain who fails to comply with a direction under this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Closure of floating restaurant

subsection.leadIn: The Director may make an order under subsection (2) if he is satisfied that a local vessel that is a floating restaurant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is being used or operated without a full licence or temporary licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is being used or operated while its full licence or temporary licence is suspended; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: is being used or operated in contravention of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any of the conditions or restrictions attached to its full licence or temporary licence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any provision of the Ordinance or this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: An order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may direct that no person, other than a public officer in the course of his duty or a person authorized by the Director, shall enter or be in the vessel or part of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may prohibit the use or operation of the vessel or part of the vessel for all or any purposes.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of an order shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: posted by the Director on a conspicuous part of the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: served by the Director on the owner or his agent.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1) in respect of a local vessel shall remain in force until the order is cancelled by the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an order made pursuant to subsection (1)(a), on the issue of a full licence or temporary licence in respect of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an order made pursuant to subsection (1)(b) or (c), on his being satisfied that the ground on which the order was made has ceased to exist; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on his being satisfied that the vessel will not be used as a floating restaurant.

subsection.continued: The cancellation by the Director shall be by notice in writing to the owner or his agent.

subsection.content: No person shall remove, obliterate, deface or otherwise render illegible an order made under subsection (1) unless the order has been cancelled.
